title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
This board was liquid damage with 5V 0A. Corrosion at cd3215 and nearby, also the PI3USB32 chip (the one we don't see on schematic &brdvw) was corroded.
Reflowed both of them and replaced all resistors around both CD32s.

Now I get 20v 0A and ppbus_g3h 0V with no short (diode mode 0,410)
Replaced u7000 and Q7030/40 and it's the same (20V 0A).

At U7000
Aux_det 5v
R7020/21/61/62 are ok
TBA_HPWR_EN_L 3.4V
PM_EN_P3V3_G3H 5V
SMC_RESET_R_L / SMC_RESET_R 3.4V
SMC_CHGR_INT_L 3.4V
CHGR_ACOK 3,3V
SMC_RST_IN 0V
PD_SMC_CBC_ON 0V

I don't know if even I get 20V I still need to check again near CD32 or even replace them, or something related with SMC?
Don't know what to check anymore at this point.

title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
CD3215 chips should be good now, if switch to 20V.
Check other U7000 voltages; VDDA/P, VR1_3P3, A/BMON.
Compare diode mode readings on secondary power supplies with good board.

title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
Oh forgot to post other u7000 voltages:
R7075 is 5ohms and VDDA/VDDP is 5V
VR1_3P3 is 3.3V 
A/BMON are both 0V / 0V (char only) with working board I get 0,050V / 0V (charger only)
TBA_COMP is 1.1V noticed it was 1,6 and 1,5V on working board

I compared diode mode reading with a working board and I found that
L7900 and L8060 are respectively 0.041 and 0.048 on the patient board as opposed to  0.245 and 0.206 on the working board...

Can I remove the coils, check from where the short is comming and eventually disconnect the feedbacks and see what happen when I plug power?

title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
Not really short, but very low values comparing with good board.
Is sufficient to lift the coils one side; no need to use hot air.
Then check where the low values come from.

title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
I lifted the coils on one side and found the low values coming from PP1V_S5G and PPVCCPCH_S5G...:(
Removed also the feedback resistor going back to the  u7800, but the low diode mode values are still present.
I started to isolate components on the PPVCCPCH_S5G path (only few caps on this rail) and I can confirm the low diode mode value is coming from U0500. Maybe some crap under the cpu but I think it's a hopeless extremely sensistive fragile board...

title: 820-00840-A A1708 20V 0A no PPBUS_G3H
message:
Nothing to lose trying to burn eventually crap.
Heat CPU until 180-200 degrees for 15-20s.
Use quality flux, not chinese honey...
